body:
Use this service to request personal information for yourself or someone else who gives you permission to act on their behalf.

You can ask for personal information, sometimes called a Subject Access Request, held by parts of the Ministry of Justice, including the: 

* Prison Service - for security and NOMIS records about time spent in prison
* Probation Service - for electronic case notes (nDelius ) about time on probation
* Office of the Public Guardian (OPG) - for information including lasting power of attorney records 
* Legal Aid Agency  (LAA) - for information including legal aid application data

components.html:
## Do not use this form to request information from the Courts and Tribunals Service (HMCTS) ##

For information held by HMCTS, contact the court or tribunal you think holds the information.

Use the [Find a court or tribunal](https://www.gov.uk/find-court-tribunal) service to find the contact details.

Completing this online form should take around 5 minutes. 

Be as specific as you can, it will help us find the information you want.

You will need to complete this form in one go. You cannot save and return.

extraComponents.html:
## Before you start ##

You will need to provide:

* photo ID and proof of address, dated in the last 6 months, for you and anyone else you're requesting information for (legal representatives do not need to provide this)
* a signed letter of consent, dated in the last 6 months, if you're requesting information on behalf of someone else

## Other ways to ask for personal information ##

You can also [send a request by email or post](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ministry-of-justice/about/personal-information-charter).

heading: Request personal information from the Ministry of Justice
